record.dc:title: 192BY13 Ledford Island, Bradley County, Tennessee. Burial 16BY178, an adult female precedent to 16BY179, an adult male which was in background. Conch columella hairpin under both mastoids. Decayed bark over right side of thorax. Square 13L5. Direction North.
record.wpa:narrative: Adult female in fair condition, extended on back with head to west. Pit precedent to 16BY179, filled with fairly dark mixed clay and humus. Pit more rectangular at level of bones. Bones lay under pieces of wood--could only be preserved over left shoulder, but appeared to have been present over whole body. Wood decayed. Bones lay on subsoil, cervical vertebrae disturbed and face disturbed, possibly by rodents. Forearms slightly away from pelvis. Shell hairpins lay under skull at mastoid. Skull tipped back to rest on lambdoidal region. Left patella missing.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration available on file. See photograph 191BY13 also.
